public char getInput_char(String message)
reads one character from the input

Parameters:
message - the message to display
Returns:
the entered character or NO_CHAR_INPUT if no input

getInput_char

public char getInput_char(String message,
                          String validChars)
reads one character from the input and validates that a valid character has been entered

Parameters:
message - the message to display
validChars - a string that contains all valid characters that can be entered
Returns:
the entered character or NO_CHAR_INPUT if no input

getInput_Double

public double getInput_Double(String message)
gets a double from the input without displaying a message

Parameters:
message - the message to display
Returns:
the entered double

getInput_DoubleBetween

public double getInput_DoubleBetween(String message,
                                     double smallestValue,
                                     double largestValue)
Displays a message and waits to read an double from the user. Verifies that the entered number is between the provided values (inclusive)

Parameters:
message - the message to display
smallestValue - the smallest possible legal value the user can enter
largestValue - the largest possible legal value the user can enter
Returns:
the double inputed by the user

getInput_DoubleGreaterThan

public double getInput_DoubleGreaterThan(String message,
                                         double smallestValue)
Displays a message and waits to read an double from the user. Verifies that the entered number is greater than or equal to smallestValue

Parameters:
message - the message to display
smallestValue - the smallest possible legal value the user can enter
Returns:
the double inputed by the user

printFormat

public void printFormat(String format,
                        Object... args)
Writes a formatted string to this output stream using the specified format string and arguments. The locale always used is the one returned by Locale.getDefault(), regardless of any previous invocations of other formatting methods on this object.

Parameters:
format - A format string as described in Format string syntax
args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by The Java™ Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.

printlnFormat

public void printlnFormat(String format,
                          Object... args)
Writes a formatted string to this output stream using the specified format string and arguments. The locale always used is the one returned by Locale.getDefault(), regardless of any previous invocations of other formatting methods on this object.

Parameters:
format - A format string as described in Format string syntax
args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by The Java™ Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.

yesNo

public boolean yesNo(String message)
Presents the user with a yes/no question used for verification. Adds the (y,n) to the provided message

Parameters:
message - the message to display
Returns:
true if the user answered yes, false otherwise
